issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi,
I am trying to start activemq service on the windows 2003 enterprise server on 64 bits machine.

I get following error while running activemq-admin.bat and activemq.bat

was unexpected at this time error

Kindly help me resolve this issue.

Thanks & Regards,
pankaj
fields.summary: Files was unexpected at this time error - while starting activemq service on windows 2003 64 bits machine

comments.body: replace the first line of activemq,bat, "echo off" with "echo on" and post the output of an execution to see which part of the script has a problem.
We really need more information if we are expected to verify or reproduce this

This logs after I put echo on

al\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin\ is expanded pathn
ame of the current script under NT

1.0\bin\..

_ACTIVEMQ_HOME=

C:\_Rizal\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin>rem find AC
TIVEMQ_HOME if it does not exist due to either an invalid value passed

C:\_Rizal\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin>rem by the
user or the activemq.bat problem on Windows 9x

C:\_Rizal\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin>if exist "C
:\_Rizal\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin\..\README.tx
t" goto checkJava

C:\_Rizal\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin>set _JAVACM
D=
Files was unexpected at this time.
C:\_Rizal\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin>if ""C:\Pro
gram Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_12"" == "" goto noJavaHome
C:\_Rizal\Server\apache-activemq-5.1.0-bin\apache-activemq-5.1.0\bin>

From the output it appears that the JAVA_HOME value is not set correctly so the script can't find a java executable to run the broker.  Ensure that the environment vars are set correctly for the user you are trying to run the scripts as and this should be fixed.
